3H12.5ZM14 12.5C14 13.3284 13.3284 14 12.5 14H7V15.5C7 15.7761 7.22386 16 7.5 16H15.5C15.7761 16 16 15.7761 16 15.5V7.5C16 7.22386 15.7761 7 15.5 7H14V12.5ZM4.5 4C4.22386 4 4 4.22386 4 4.5V12.5C4 style="width:20px;height:20px;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" style="flex-shrink:0" class="absolute transition-opacity duration-200 text-text-500 opacity-0" aria-hidden="true"><path d="M15.1883 5.10908C15.3699 4.96398 15.6346 4.96153 15.8202 5.11592C16.0056 5.27067 16.0504 5.53125 15.9403 5.73605L15.8836 5.82003L8.38354 14.8202C8.29361 14.9279 8.16242 14.9925 8.02221 14.9989C7.88203 15.0051 7.74545 14.9526 7.64622 14.8534L4.14617 11.3533L4.08172 11.2752C3.95384 11.0811 3.97542 10.817 4.14617 10.6463C4.31693 10.4755 4.58105 10.4539 4.77509 10.5818L4.85321 10.6463L7.96556 13.7586L15.1161 5.1794L15.1883 5.10908Z"></path></svg></div></div></button></div></div><div class="relative py-4 pl-4 font-mono text-sm md:text-sm overflow-x-auto code-block-scroll" tabindex="0"><pre class="inline-block min-w-full pr-4"><code>Your context window will be automatically compacted as it approaches its limit, allowing you to continue working indefinitely from where you left off. Therefore, do not stop tasks early due to token budget concerns. As you approach your token budget limit, save your current progress and state to memory before the context window refreshes. Always be as persistent and autonomous as possible and complete tasks fully, even if the end of your budget is approaching. Never artificially stop any task early regardless of the context remaining.</code></pre></div></div>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">The <a class="inline-link" href="/docs/en/agents-and-tools/tool-use/memory-tool">memory tool</a> pairs naturally with context awareness for seamless context transitions.</p>
<h4 class="text-lg font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100"><div class="group relative pt-6 pb-2" id="multi-context-window-workflows"><div class="absolute hidden lg:flex lg:items-center lg:-ml-8 top-[calc(1.5rem+0.05em)]"><button class="inline-flex
  items-center
  justify-center
  relative
  shrink-0
  can-focus
  select-none
  disabled:pointer-events-none
  disabled:opacity-50
  disabled:shadow-none
  disabled:drop-shadow-none border-transparent
          transition
          font-base
          duration-300
          ease-[cubic-bezier(0.165,0.85,0.45,1)] h-6 w-6 rounded-md active:scale-95 opacity-0 group-hover:opacity-100 transition-opacity duration-200 text-text-500 hover:text-text-100 Button_ghost__BUAoh" type="button" aria-label="Copy link to clipboard" title="Copy link to clipboard" data-state="closed"><div class="inline" style="width:20px;height:20px;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" style="flex-shrink:0" class="inline" aria-hidden="true"><path d="M13.6229 9.64789C13.8798 9.54672 14.1701 9.6724 14.2714 9.92914L15.2792 12.4878C16.0889 14.5432 15.0788 16.8666 13.0233 17.6763C11.0323 18.4603 8.79012 17.5367 7.91585 15.6098L7.83577 15.4204L6.82795 12.8618C6.72674 12.6048 6.85325 12.3145 7.11018 12.2133C7.36701 12.1122 7.65732 12.2379 7.75862 12.4946L8.76645 15.0532C9.37368 16.5947 11.1156 17.3528 12.6571 16.7456C14.1986 16.1384 14.9557 14.3965 14.3485 12.8549L13.3407 10.2963C13.2395 10.0395 13.3661 9.74917 13.6229 9.64789ZM8.90024 7.20842C9.15717 7.10721 9.44747 7.23372 9.54868 7.49065L11.3817 12.143C11.4826 12.3998 11.3563 12.6903 11.0995 12.7915C10.8426 12.8925 10.5523 12.766 10.451 12.5092L8.61898 7.85686C8.5178 7.59999 8.64342 7.30969 8.90024 7.20842ZM7.16975 2.25331C9.17539 1.57852 11.3796 2.58838 12.1639 4.5795L13.1718 7.13811C13.273 7.39504 13.1465 7.68534 12.8895 7.78655C12.6327 7.88749 12.3423 7.76113 12.2411 7.50432L11.2333 4.94571C10.6259 3.40439 8.88406 2.6471 7.3426 3.25429C5.80118 3.86161 5.04399 5.60345 5.65118 7.14494L6.659 9.70355C6.76021 9.96048 6.6337 10.2508 6.37677 10.352C6.11988 10.4531 5.82952 10.3266 5.72833 10.0698L4.7205 7.51116C3.91111 5.45581 4.92107 3.13323 6.97639 2.32362L7.16975 2.25331Z"></path></svg></div></button></div><div>Multi-context window workflows</div><div class="absolute top-0 -right-6 hidden lg:flex"></div></div></h4>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">For tasks spanning multiple context windows:</p>
<ol class="list-none pl-8 [counter-reset:item] [&amp;_ul]:pl-8 [&amp;_ol]:pl-8 [&amp;_ol]:[counter-reset:item] mb-4">
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">Use a different prompt for the very first context window</strong>: Use the first context window to set up a framework (write tests, create setup scripts), then use future context windows to iterate on a todo-list.</p>
</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">Have the model write tests in a structured format</strong>: Ask Claude to create tests before starting work and keep track of them in a structured format (e.g., <code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">tests.json</code>). This leads to better long-term ability to iterate. Remind Claude of the importance of tests: &quot;It is unacceptable to remove or edit tests because this could lead to missing or buggy functionality.&quot;</p>
</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">Set up quality of life tools</strong>: Encourage Claude to create setup scripts (e.g., <code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">init.sh</code>) to gracefully start servers, run test suites, and linters. This prevents repeated work when continuing from a fresh context window.</p>
</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">Starting fresh vs compacting</strong>: When a context window is cleared, consider starting with a brand new context window rather than using compaction. Claude&#x27;s latest models are extremely effective at discovering state from the local filesystem. In some cases, you may want to take advantage of this over compaction. Be prescriptive about how it should start:</p>
<ul class="list-none pl-8 [&amp;_ul]:pl-8 [&amp;_ol]:pl-8 mb-4">
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">&quot;Call pwd; you can only read and write files in this directory.&quot;</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">&quot;Review progress.txt, tests.json, and the git logs.&quot;</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">&quot;Manually run through a fundamental integration test before moving on to implementing new features.&quot;</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">Provide verification tools</strong>: As the length of autonomous tasks grows, Claude needs to verify correctness without continuous human feedback. Tools like Playwright MCP server or computer use capabilities for testing UIs are helpful.</p>
</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">Encourage complete usage of context</strong>: Prompt Claude to efficiently complete components before moving on:</p>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="group relative my-6 rounded-lg bg-bg-000 overflow-hidden border-0.5 border-border-300"><div class="group flex items-center justify-between border-b-0.5 border-border-300 px-4 py-1.5 bg-bg-200"><div class="flex items-center gap-2 text-sm text-text-500">Sample prompt</div><div class="flex items-center gap-1"><button class="inline-flex
  items-center
  justify-center
  relative
  shrink-0
  can-focus
  select-none
  disabled:pointer-events-none
  disabled:opacity-50
  disabled:shadow-none
  disabled:drop-shadow-none border-transparent
          transition
          font-base
          duration-300
          ease-[cubic-bezier(0.165,0.85,0.45,1)] h-8 w-8 rounded-md active:scale-95 Button_ghost__BUAoh" type="button" aria-label="Copy code"><div class="relative flex items-center justify-center"><div class="transition-opacity duration-200 text-text-500 opacity-100" style="width:20px;height:20px;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" style="flex-shrink:0" class="transition-opacity duration-200 text-text-500 opacity-100" aria-hidden="true"><path d="M12.5 3C13.3284 3 14 3.67157 14 4.5V6H15.5C16.3284 6 17 6.67157 17 7.5V15.5C17 16.3284 16.3284 17 15.5 17H7.5C6.67157 17 6 16.3284 6 15.5V14H4.5C3.67157 14 3 13.3284 3 12.5V4.5C3 3.67157 3.67157 3 4.5 <ul class="list-none pl-8 [&amp;_ul]:pl-8 [&amp;_ol]:pl-8 mb-4">
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]"><strong class="font-semibold">Use structured formats for state data</strong>: When tracking structured information (like test results or task status), use JSON or other structured formats to help Claude understand schema requirements</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]"><strong class="font-semibold">Use unstructured text for progress notes</strong>: Freeform progress notes work well for tracking general progress and context</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]"><strong class="font-semibold">Use git for state tracking</strong>: Git provides a log of what&#x27;s been done and checkpoints that can be restored. Claude&#x27;s latest models perform especially well in using git to track state across multiple sessions.</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]"><strong class="font-semibold">Emphasize incremental progress</strong>: Explicitly ask Claude to keep track of its progress and focus on incremental work</li>
</ul>

pr-4"><code>Consider the reversibility and potential impact of your actions. You are encouraged to take local, reversible actions like editing files or running tests, but for actions that are hard to reverse, affect shared systems, or could be destructive, ask the user before proceeding.

Examples of actions that warrant confirmation:
- Destructive operations: deleting files or branches, dropping database tables, rm -rf
- Hard to reverse operations: git push --force, git reset --hard, amending published commits
- Operations visible to others: pushing code, commenting on PRs/issues, sending messages, modifying shared infrastructure

When encountering obstacles, do not use destructive actions as a shortcut. For example, don&#x27;t bypass safety checks (e.g. --no-verify) or discard unfamiliar files that may be in-progress work.</code></pre></div></div>

<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">Claude&#x27;s latest models demonstrate exceptional agentic search capabilities and can find and synthesize information from multiple sources effectively. For optimal research results:</p>
<ol class="list-none pl-8 [counter-reset:item] [&amp;_ul]:pl-8 [&amp;_ol]:pl-8 [&amp;_ol]:[counter-reset:item] mb-4">
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">Provide clear success criteria</strong>: Define what constitutes a successful answer to your research question</p>
</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">Encourage source verification</strong>: Ask Claude to verify information across multiple sources</p>
</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">For complex research tasks, use a structured approach</strong>:</p>
</li>

pr-4"><code>Search for this information in a structured way. As you gather data, develop several competing hypotheses. Track your confidence levels in your progress notes to improve calibration. Regularly self-critique your approach and plan. Update a hypothesis tree or research notes file to persist information and provide transparency. Break down this complex research task systematically.</code></pre></div></div>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">This structured approach allows Claude to find and synthesize virtually any piece of information and iteratively critique its findings, no matter the size of the corpus.</p>
<h3 class="text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100"><div class="group relative pt-6 pb-2" id="subagent-orchestration"><div class="absolute hidden lg:flex lg:items-center lg:-ml-8 top-[calc(1.5rem+0.08em)]"><button class="inline-flex
  items-center
  justify-center
  relative
  shrink-0
  can-focus
  select-none
  disabled:pointer-events-none
  disabled:opacity-50
  disabled:shadow-none
  disabled:drop-shadow-none border-transparent
          transition
          font-base
          duration-300
          ease-[cubic-bezier(0.165,0.85,0.45,1)] h-6 w-6 rounded-md active:scale-95 opacity-0 group-hover:opacity-100 transition-opacity duration-200 text-text-500 hover:text-text-100 Button_ghost__BUAoh" type="button" aria-label="Copy link to clipboard" title="Copy link to clipboard" data-state="closed"><div class="inline" style="width:20px;height:20px;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" style="flex-shrink:0" class="inline" aria-hidden="true"><path d="M13.6229 9.64789C13.8798 9.54672 14.1701 9.6724 14.2714 9.92914L15.2792 12.4878C16.0889 14.5432 15.0788 16.8666 13.0233 17.6763C11.0323 18.4603 8.79012 17.5367 7.91585 15.6098L7.83577 15.4204L6.82795 12.8618C6.72674 12.6048 6.85325 12.3145 7.11018 12.2133C7.36701 12.1122 7.65732 12.2379 7.75862 12.4946L8.76645 15.0532C9.37368 16.5947 11.1156 17.3528 12.6571 16.7456C14.1986 16.1384 14.9557 14.3965 14.3485 12.8549L13.3407 10.2963C13.2395 10.0395 13.3661 9.74917 13.6229 9.64789ZM8.90024 7.20842C9.15717 7.10721 9.44747 7.23372 9.54868 7.49065L11.3817 12.143C11.4826 12.3998 11.3563 12.6903 11.0995 12.7915C10.8426 12.8925 10.5523 12.766 10.451 12.5092L8.61898 7.85686C8.5178 7.59999 8.64342 7.30969 8.90024 7.20842ZM7.16975 2.25331C9.17539 1.57852 11.3796 2.58838 12.1639 4.5795L13.1718 7.13811C13.273 7.39504 13.1465 7.68534 12.8895 7.78655C12.6327 7.88749 12.3423 7.76113 12.2411 7.50432L11.2333 4.94571C10.6259 3.40439 8.88406 2.6471 7.3426 3.25429C5.80118 3.86161 5.04399 5.60345 5.65118 7.14494L6.659 9.70355C6.76021 9.96048 6.6337 10.2508 6.37677 10.352C6.11988 10.4531 5.82952 10.3266 5.72833 10.0698L4.7205 7.51116C3.91111 5.45581 4.92107 3.13323 6.97639 2.32362L7.16975 2.25331Z"></path></svg></div></button></div><div>Subagent orchestration</div><div class="absolute top-0 -right-6 hidden lg:flex"></div></div></h3>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">Claude&#x27;s latest models demonstrate significantly improved native subagent orchestration capabilities. These models can recognize when tasks would benefit from delegating work to specialized subagents and do so proactively without requiring explicit instruction.</p>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">To take advantage of this behavior:</p>
<ol class="list-none pl-8 [counter-reset:item] [&amp;_ul]:pl-8 [&amp;_ol]:pl-8 [&amp;_ol]:[counter-reset:item] mb-4">
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]"><strong class="font-semibold">Ensure well-defined subagent tools</strong>: Have subagent tools available and described in tool definitions</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]"><strong class="font-semibold">Let Claude orchestrate naturally</strong>: Claude will delegate appropriately without explicit instruction</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]"><strong class="font-semibold">Watch for overuse</strong>: Claude Opus 4.6 has a strong predilection for subagents and may spawn them in situations where a simpler, direct approach would suffice. For example, the model may spawn subagents for code exploration when a direct grep call is faster and sufficient.</li>
</ol>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">If you&#x27;re seeing excessive subagent use, add explicit guidance about when subagents are and aren&#x27;t warranted:</p>

pr-4"><code>Use subagents when tasks can run in parallel, require isolated context, or involve independent workstreams that don&#x27;t need to share state. <p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">With adaptive thinking and subagent orchestration, Claude handles most multi-step reasoning internally. Explicit prompt chaining  breaking a task into sequential API calls  is still useful when you need to inspect intermediate outputs or enforce a specific pipeline structure.</p>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">The most common chaining pattern is <strong class="font-semibold">self-correction</strong>: generate a draft  have Claude review it against criteria  have Claude refine based on the review. Each step is a separate API call so you can log, evaluate, or branch at any point.</p>

<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">Claude&#x27;s latest models may sometimes create new files for testing and iteration purposes, particularly when working with code. This approach allows Claude to use files, especially python scripts, as a &#x27;temporary scratchpad&#x27; before saving its final output. Using temporary files can improve outcomes particularly for agentic coding use cases.</p>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">If you&#x27;d prefer to minimize net new file creation, you can instruct Claude to clean up after itself:</p>

<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">Claude Opus 4.5 and Claude Opus 4.6 have a tendency to overengineer by creating extra files, adding unnecessary abstractions, or building in flexibility that wasn&#x27;t requested. If you&#x27;re seeing this undesired behavior, add specific guidance to keep solutions minimal.</p>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">For example:</p>
<div class="group relative my-6 rounded-lg bg-bg-000 overflow-hidden border-0.5 border-border-300"><div class="group flex items-center justify-between border-b-0.5 border-border-300 px-4 py-1.5 bg-bg-200"><div class="flex items-center gap-2 text-sm text-text-500">Sample prompt to minimize overengineering</div><div class="flex items-center gap-1"><button class="inline-flex

  disabled:opacity-50
  disabled:shadow-none
  disabled:drop-shadow-none border-transparent
          transition
          font-base
          duration-300

pr-4"><code>Avoid over-engineering. Only make changes that are directly requested or clearly necessary. Keep solutions simple and focused:

- Scope: Don&#x27;t add features, refactor code, or make &quot;improvements&quot; beyond what was asked. A bug fix doesn&#x27;t need surrounding code cleaned up. A simple feature doesn&#x27;t need extra configurability.

- Documentation: Don&#x27;t add docstrings, comments, or type annotations to code you didn&#x27;t change. Only add comments where the logic isn&#x27;t self-evident.

- Defensive coding: Don&#x27;t add error handling, fallbacks, or validation for scenarios that can&#x27;t happen. Trust internal code and framework guarantees. Only validate at system boundaries (user input, external APIs).

- Abstractions: Don&#x27;t create helpers, utilities, or abstractions for one-time operations. Don&#x27;t design for hypothetical future requirements. The right amount of complexity is the minimum needed for the current task.</code></pre></div></div>

<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">Claude Opus 4.5 and Claude Opus 4.6 have improved vision capabilities compared to previous Claude models. They perform better on image processing and data extraction tasks, particularly when there are multiple images present in context. These improvements carry over to computer use, where the models can more reliably interpret screenshots and UI elements. You can also use these models to analyze videos by breaking them up into frames.</p>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">One technique we&#x27;ve found effective to further boost performance is to give Claude a crop tool or <a class="inline-link" href="/docs/en/agents-and-tools/agent-skills/overview">skill</a>. We&#x27;ve seen consistent uplift on image evaluations when Claude is able to &quot;zoom&quot; in on relevant regions of an image. We&#x27;ve put together a <a class="inline-link" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://platform.claude.com/cookbook/multimodal-crop-tool">cookbook for the crop tool</a>.</p>
<h3 class="text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100"><div class="group relative pt-6 pb-2" id="frontend-design"><div class="absolute hidden lg:flex lg:items-center lg:-ml-8 top-[calc(1.5rem+0.08em)]"><button class="inline-flex
  items-center
  justify-center
  relative
  shrink-0
  can-focus
  select-none
  disabled:pointer-events-none
  disabled:opacity-50
  disabled:shadow-none
  disabled:drop-shadow-none border-transparent
          transition
          font-base
          duration-300
          ease-[cubic-bezier(0.165,0.85,0.45,1)] h-6 w-6 rounded-md active:scale-95 opacity-0 group-hover:opacity-100 transition-opacity duration-200 text-text-500 hover:text-text-100 Button_ghost__BUAoh" type="button" aria-label="Copy link to clipboard" title="Copy link to clipboard" data-state="closed"><div class="inline" style="width:20px;height:20px;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" style="flex-shrink:0" class="inline" aria-hidden="true"><path d="M13.6229 9.64789C13.8798 9.54672 14.1701 9.6724 14.2714 9.92914L15.2792 12.4878C16.0889 14.5432 15.0788 16.8666 13.0233 17.6763C11.0323 18.4603 8.79012 17.5367 7.91585 15.6098L7.83577 15.4204L6.82795 12.8618C6.72674 12.6048 6.85325 12.3145 7.11018 12.2133C7.36701 12.1122 7.65732 12.2379 7.75862 12.4946L8.76645 15.0532C9.37368 16.5947 11.1156 17.3528 12.6571 16.7456C14.1986 16.1384 14.9557 14.3965 14.3485 12.8549L13.3407 10.2963C13.2395 10.0395 13.3661 9.74917 13.6229 9.64789ZM8.90024 7.20842C9.15717 7.10721 9.44747 7.23372 9.54868 7.49065L11.3817 12.143C11.4826 12.3998 11.3563 12.6903 11.0995 12.7915C10.8426 12.8925 10.5523 12.766 10.451 12.5092L8.61898 7.85686C8.5178 7.59999 8.64342 7.30969 8.90024 7.20842ZM7.16975 2.25331C9.17539 1.57852 11.3796 2.58838 12.1639 4.5795L13.1718 7.13811C13.273 7.39504 13.1465 7.68534 12.8895 7.78655C12.6327 7.88749 12.3423 7.76113 12.2411 7.50432L11.2333 4.94571C10.6259 3.40439 8.88406 2.6471 7.3426 3.25429C5.80118 3.86161 5.04399 5.60345 5.65118 7.14494L6.659 9.70355C6.76021 9.96048 6.6337 10.2508 6.37677 10.352C6.11988 10.4531 5.82952 10.3266 5.72833 10.0698L4.7205 7.51116C3.91111 5.45581 4.92107 3.13323 6.97639 2.32362L7.16975 2.25331Z"></path></svg></div></button></div><div>Frontend design</div><div class="absolute top-0 -right-6 hidden lg:flex"></div></div></h3>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">Claude Opus 4.5 and Claude Opus 4.6 excel at building complex, real-world web applications with strong frontend design. However, without guidance, models can default to generic patterns that create what users call the &quot;AI slop&quot; aesthetic. To create distinctive, creative frontends that surprise and delight:</p>
<div class="flex w-full rounded-lg px-4 py-3 gap-1 items-start text-sm border-0.5 my-6 border-border-200 bg-bg-200 callout"><div class="flex mr-2 shrink-0 pt-[1.375px] text-text-000"><div 16 4.68629 16 8C16 9.73776 15.2608 11.3033 14.0811 12.3984L13.8389 12.6113C13.3268 13.0382 13 13.5753 13 14.124V15.5C13 15.7761 12.7761 16 12.5 16H7.5C7.22386 16 7 15.7761 7 15.5V14.124C6.99998 13.6438 6.7495 13.1727 6.34375 12.7764L6.16113 12.6113C4.84147 11.5115 4 9.85368 4 8C4 4.68629 6.68629 2 10 2ZM10 3C7.23858 3 5 5.23858 5 8C5 9.5443 5.69948 10.9248 6.80078 11.8428L7.03711 12.0557C7.57356 12.5787 7.99998 13.2899 8 14.124V15H9.5V11.207L7.14648 8.85352L7.08203 8.77539C6.95387 8.58131 6.97562 8.31735 7.14648 8.14648C7.31735 7.97562 7.58131 7.95387 7.77539 8.08203L7.85352 8.14648L10 10.293L12.1465 8.14648L12.2246 8.08203C12.4187 7.95387 12.6827 7.97562 12.8535 8.14648C13.0244 8.31735 13.0461 8.58131 12.918 8.77539L12.8535 8.85352L10.5 11.207V15H12V14.124C12 13.1706 12.5575 12.3776 13.1992 11.8428L13.4004 11.665C14.3848 10.7513 15 9.44786 15 8C15 5.23858 12.7614 3 10 3Z"></path></svg></div></div><div class="grow min-w-0 leading-relaxed [&amp;&gt;*:last-child]:mb-0 text-text-000 [&amp;_li]:before:text-text-000/60 [&amp;_blockquote]:border-l-text-000/60 [&amp;_code]:text-text-000 [&amp;_code]:bg-text-000/10"><p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">For a detailed guide on improving frontend design, see the blog post on <a class="inline-link" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://www.claude.com/blog/improving-frontend-design-through-skills">improving frontend design through skills</a>.</p></div></div>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">Here&#x27;s a system prompt snippet you can use to encourage better frontend design:</p>
<div class="group relative my-6 rounded-lg bg-bg-000 overflow-hidden border-0.5 border-border-300"><div class="group flex items-center justify-between border-b-0.5 border-border-300 px-4 py-1.5 bg-bg-200"><div class="flex items-center gap-2 text-sm text-text-500">Sample prompt for frontend aesthetics</div><div class="flex items-center gap-1"><button class="inline-flex
  items-center
  justify-center
  relative
  shrink-0
  can-focus
  select-none
  disabled:pointer-events-none
  disabled:opacity-50
  disabled:shadow-none
  disabled:drop-shadow-none border-transparent
          transition
          font-base
          duration-300
          ease-[cubic-bezier(0.165,0.85,0.45,1)] h-8 w-8 rounded-md active:scale-95 Button_ghost__BUAoh" type="button" aria-label="Copy code"><div class="relative flex items-center justify-center"><div class="transition-opacity duration-200 text-text-500 opacity-100" style="width:20px;height:20px;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" style="flex-shrink:0" class="transition-opacity duration-200 text-text-500 opacity-100" aria-hidden="true"><path d="M12.5 3C13.3284 3 14 3.67157 14 4.5V6H15.5C16.3284 6 17 6.67157 17 7.5V15.5C17 16.3284 16.3284 17 15.5 17H7.5C6.67157 17 6 16.3284 6 15.5V14H4.5C3.67157 14 3 13.3284 3 12.5V4.5C3 3.67157 3.67157 3 4.5 3H12.5ZM14 12.5C14 13.3284 13.3284 14 12.5 14H7V15.5C7 15.7761 7.22386 16 7.5 16H15.5C15.7761 16 16 15.7761 16 15.5V7.5C16 7.22386 15.7761 7 15.5 7H14V12.5ZM4.5 4C4.22386 4 4 4.22386 4 4.5V12.5C4 12.7761 4.22386 13 4.5 13H12.5C12.7761 13 13 12.7761 13 12.5V4.5C13 4.22386 12.7761 4 12.5 4H4.5Z"></path></svg></div><div class="absolute transition-opacity duration-200 text-text-500 opacity-0" style="width:20px;height:20px;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" style="flex-shrink:0" class="absolute transition-opacity duration-200 text-text-500 opacity-0" aria-hidden="true"><path d="M15.1883 5.10908C15.3699 4.96398 15.6346 4.96153 15.8202 5.11592C16.0056 5.27067 16.0504 5.53125 15.9403 5.73605L15.8836 5.82003L8.38354 14.8202C8.29361 14.9279 8.16242 14.9925 8.02221 14.9989C7.88203 15.0051 7.74545 14.9526 7.64622 14.8534L4.14617 11.3533L4.08172 11.2752C3.95384 11.0811 3.97542 10.817 4.14617 10.6463C4.31693 10.4755 4.58105 10.4539 4.77509 10.5818L4.85321 10.6463L7.96556 13.7586L15.1161 5.1794L15.1883 5.10908Z"></path></svg></div></div></button></div></div><div class="relative py-4 pl-4 font-mono text-sm md:text-sm overflow-x-auto code-block-scroll" tabindex="0"><pre class="inline-block min-w-full pr-4"><code>&lt;frontend_aesthetics&gt;
You tend to converge toward generic, &quot;on distribution&quot; outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the &quot;AI slop&quot; aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.

Focus on:
- Typography: Choose fonts that are beautiful, unique, and interesting. Avoid generic fonts like Arial and Inter; opt instead for distinctive choices that elevate the frontend&#x27;s aesthetics.
- Color &amp; Theme: Commit to a cohesive aesthetic. Use CSS variables for consistency. Dominant colors with sharp accents outperform timid, evenly-distributed palettes. Draw from IDE themes and cultural aesthetics for inspiration.
- Motion: Use animations for effects and micro-interactions. Prioritize CSS-only solutions for HTML. Use Motion library for React when available. Focus on high-impact moments: one well-orchestrated page load with staggered reveals (animation-delay) creates more delight than scattered micro-interactions.
- Backgrounds: Create atmosphere and depth rather than defaulting to solid colors. Layer CSS gradients, use geometric patterns, or add contextual effects that match the overall aesthetic.

Avoid generic AI-generated aesthetics:
- Overused font families (Inter, Roboto, Arial, system fonts)
- Clichd color schemes (particularly purple gradients on white backgrounds)
- Predictable layouts and component patterns
- Cookie-cutter design that lacks context-specific character

Interpret creatively and make unexpected choices that feel genuinely designed for the context. Vary between light and dark themes, different fonts, different aesthetics. You still tend to converge on common choices (Space Grotesk, for example) across generations. Avoid this: it is critical that you think outside the box!
&lt;/frontend_aesthetics&gt;</code></pre></div></div>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">You can also refer to the <a class="inline-link" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code/blob/main/plugins/frontend-design/skills/frontend-design/SKILL.md">full skill definition</a>.</p>
<h2 class="font-heading leading-[1.25] text-text-100"><div class="group relative pt-6 pb-2" id="migration-considerations"><div class="absolute hidden lg:flex lg:items-center lg:-ml-8 top-[calc(1.5rem+0.175em)]"><button class="inline-flex
  items-center
  justify-center
  relative
  shrink-0
  can-focus
  select-none
  disabled:pointer-events-none
  disabled:opacity-50
  disabled:shadow-none
  disabled:drop-shadow-none border-transparent
          transition
          font-base
          duration-300
          ease-[cubic-bezier(0.165,0.85,0.45,1)] h-6 w-6 rounded-md active:scale-95 opacity-0 group-hover:opacity-100 transition-opacity duration-200 text-text-500 hover:text-text-100 Button_ghost__BUAoh" type="button" aria-label="Copy link to clipboard" title="Copy link to clipboard" data-state="closed"><div class="inline" style="width:20px;height:20px;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" style="flex-shrink:0" class="inline" aria-hidden="true"><path d="M13.6229 9.64789C13.8798 9.54672 14.1701 9.6724 14.2714 9.92914L15.2792 12.4878C16.0889 14.5432 15.0788 16.8666 13.0233 17.6763C11.0323 18.4603 8.79012 17.5367 7.91585 15.6098L7.83577 15.4204L6.82795 12.8618C6.72674 12.6048 6.85325 12.3145 7.11018 12.2133C7.36701 12.1122 7.65732 12.2379 7.75862 12.4946L8.76645 15.0532C9.37368 16.5947 11.1156 17.3528 12.6571 16.7456C14.1986 16.1384 14.9557 14.3965 14.3485 12.8549L13.3407 10.2963C13.2395 10.0395 13.3661 9.74917 13.6229 9.64789ZM8.90024 7.20842C9.15717 7.10721 9.44747 7.23372 9.54868 7.49065L11.3817 12.143C11.4826 12.3998 11.3563 12.6903 11.0995 12.7915C10.8426 12.8925 10.5523 12.766 10.451 12.5092L8.61898 7.85686C8.5178 7.59999 8.64342 7.30969 8.90024 7.20842ZM7.16975 2.25331C9.17539 1.57852 11.3796 2.58838 12.1639 4.5795L13.1718 7.13811C13.273 7.39504 13.1465 7.68534 12.8895 7.78655C12.6327 7.88749 12.3423 7.76113 12.2411 7.50432L11.2333 4.94571C10.6259 3.40439 8.88406 2.6471 7.3426 3.25429C5.80118 3.86161 5.04399 5.60345 5.65118 7.14494L6.659 9.70355C6.76021 9.96048 6.6337 10.2508 6.37677 10.352C6.11988 10.4531 5.82952 10.3266 5.72833 10.0698L4.7205 7.51116C3.91111 5.45581 4.92107 3.13323 6.97639 2.32362L7.16975 2.25331Z"></path></svg></div></button></div><div>Migration considerations</div><div class="absolute top-0 -right-6 hidden lg:flex"></div></div></h2>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">When migrating to Claude 4.6 models from earlier generations:</p>
<ol class="list-none pl-8 [counter-reset:item] [&amp;_ul]:pl-8 [&amp;_ol]:pl-8 [&amp;_ol]:[counter-reset:item] mb-4">
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">Be specific about desired behavior</strong>: Consider describing exactly what you&#x27;d like to see in the output.</p>
</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">Frame your instructions with modifiers</strong>: Adding modifiers that encourage Claude to increase the quality and detail of its output can help better shape Claude&#x27;s performance. For example, instead of &quot;Create an analytics dashboard&quot;, use &quot;Create an analytics dashboard. Include as many relevant features and interactions as possible. Go beyond the basics to create a fully-featured implementation.&quot;</p>
</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">Request specific features explicitly</strong>: Animations and interactive elements should be requested explicitly when desired.</p>
</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">Update thinking configuration</strong>: Claude 4.6 models use <a class="inline-link" href="/docs/en/build-with-claude/adaptive-thinking">adaptive thinking</a> (<code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">thinking: {type: &quot;adaptive&quot;}</code>) instead of manual thinking with <code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">budget_tokens</code>. Use the <a class="inline-link" href="/docs/en/build-with-claude/effort">effort parameter</a> to control thinking depth.</p>
</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">Migrate away from prefilled responses</strong>: Prefilled responses on the last assistant turn are deprecated starting with Claude 4.6 models. See <a class="inline-link" href="#migrating-away-from-prefilled-responses">Migrating away from prefilled responses</a> for detailed guidance on alternatives.</p>
</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">Tune anti-laziness prompting</strong>: If your prompts previously encouraged the model to be more thorough or use tools more aggressively, dial back that guidance. Claude 4.6 models are significantly more proactive and may overtrigger on instructions that were needed for previous models.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">For detailed migration steps, see the <a class="inline-link" href="/docs/en/about-claude/models/migration-guide">Migration guide</a>.</p>
<h3 class="text-xl font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100"><div class="group relative pt-6 pb-2" id="migrating-from-claude-sonnet-4-5-to-claude-sonnet-4-6"><div class="absolute hidden lg:flex lg:items-center lg:-ml-8 top-[calc(1.5rem+0.08em)]"><button class="inline-flex
  items-center
  justify-center
  relative
  shrink-0
  can-focus
  select-none
  disabled:pointer-events-none
  disabled:opacity-50
  disabled:shadow-none
  disabled:drop-shadow-none border-transparent
          transition
          font-base
          duration-300
          ease-[cubic-bezier(0.165,0.85,0.45,1)] h-6 w-6 rounded-md active:scale-95 opacity-0 group-hover:opacity-100 transition-opacity duration-200 text-text-500 hover:text-text-100 Button_ghost__BUAoh" type="button" aria-label="Copy link to clipboard" title="Copy link to clipboard" data-state="closed"><div class="inline" style="width:20px;height:20px;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" style="flex-shrink:0" class="inline" aria-hidden="true"><path d="M13.6229 9.64789C13.8798 9.54672 14.1701 9.6724 14.2714 9.92914L15.2792 12.4878C16.0889 14.5432 15.0788 16.8666 13.0233 17.6763C11.0323 18.4603 8.79012 17.5367 7.91585 15.6098L7.83577 15.4204L6.82795 12.8618C6.72674 12.6048 6.85325 12.3145 7.11018 12.2133C7.36701 12.1122 7.65732 12.2379 7.75862 12.4946L8.76645 15.0532C9.37368 16.5947 11.1156 17.3528 12.6571 16.7456C14.1986 16.1384 14.9557 14.3965 14.3485 12.8549L13.3407 10.2963C13.2395 10.0395 13.3661 9.74917 13.6229 9.64789ZM8.90024 7.20842C9.15717 7.10721 9.44747 7.23372 9.54868 7.49065L11.3817 12.143C11.4826 12.3998 11.3563 12.6903 11.0995 12.7915C10.8426 12.8925 10.5523 12.766 10.451 12.5092L8.61898 7.85686C8.5178 7.59999 8.64342 7.30969 8.90024 7.20842ZM7.16975 2.25331C9.17539 1.57852 11.3796 2.58838 12.1639 4.5795L13.1718 7.13811C13.273 7.39504 13.1465 7.68534 12.8895 7.78655C12.6327 7.88749 12.3423 7.76113 12.2411 7.50432L11.2333 4.94571C10.6259 3.40439 8.88406 2.6471 7.3426 3.25429C5.80118 3.86161 5.04399 5.60345 5.65118 7.14494L6.659 9.70355C6.76021 9.96048 6.6337 10.2508 6.37677 10.352C6.11988 10.4531 5.82952 10.3266 5.72833 10.0698L4.7205 7.51116C3.91111 5.45581 4.92107 3.13323 6.97639 2.32362L7.16975 2.25331Z"></path></svg></div></button></div><div>Migrating from Claude Sonnet 4.5 to Claude Sonnet 4.6</div><div class="absolute top-0 -right-6 hidden lg:flex"></div></div></h3>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">Claude Sonnet 4.6 defaults to an effort level of <code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">high</code>, in contrast to Claude Sonnet 4.5 which had no effort parameter. Consider adjusting the effort parameter as you migrate from Claude Sonnet 4.5 to Claude Sonnet 4.6. If not explicitly set, you may experience higher latency with the default effort level.</p>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">Recommended effort settings:</strong></p>
<ul class="list-none pl-8 [&amp;_ul]:pl-8 [&amp;_ol]:pl-8 mb-4">
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]"><strong class="font-semibold">Medium</strong> for most applications</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]"><strong class="font-semibold">Low</strong> for high-volume or latency-sensitive workloads</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]">Set a large max output token budget (64k tokens recommended) at medium or high effort to give the model room to think and act</li>
</ul>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">When to use Opus 4.6 instead:</strong> For the hardest, longest-horizon problems (large-scale code migrations, deep research, extended autonomous work), Opus 4.6 remains the right choice. Sonnet 4.6 is optimized for workloads where fast turnaround and cost efficiency matter most.</p>

<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">If you&#x27;re not using extended thinking on Claude Sonnet 4.5, you can continue without it on Claude Sonnet 4.6. You should explicitly set effort to the level appropriate for your use case. At <code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">low</code> effort with thinking disabled, you can expect similar or better performance relative to Claude Sonnet 4.5 with no extended thinking.</p>

<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">If you&#x27;re using extended thinking on Claude Sonnet 4.5, it continues to be supported on Claude Sonnet 4.6 with no changes needed to your thinking configuration. Consider keeping a thinking budget around 16k tokens. In practice, most tasks don&#x27;t use that much, but it provides headroom for harder problems without risk of runaway token usage.</p>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">For coding use cases</strong> (agentic coding, tool-heavy workflows, code generation):</p>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">Start with <code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">medium</code> effort. If you find latency is too high, consider reducing effort to <code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">low</code>. If you need higher intelligence, consider increasing effort to <code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">high</code> or migrating to Opus 4.6.</p>

<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0"><strong class="font-semibold">For chat and non-coding use cases</strong> (chat, content generation, search, classification):</p>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">Start with <code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">low</code> effort with extended thinking. If you need more depth, increase effort to <code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">medium</code>.</p>
<div class="group relative my-6 rounded-lg bg-bg-000 overflow-hidden border-0.5 border-border-300"><div class="relative py-4 pl-4 font-mono text-sm md:text-sm overflow-x-auto code-block-scroll" tabindex="0"><div class="inline-block min-w-full pr-4"><pre class="shiki shiki-themes github-light-default dark-plus" style="--shiki-light:#1f2328;--shiki-dark:#f3f7f6;--shiki-light-bg:transparent;--shiki-dark-bg:transparent" tabindex="0"><code><span class="line"><span style="--shiki-light:#1F2328;--shiki-dark:#f3f7f6">client.messages.create(</span></span>

<h4 class="text-lg font-medium leading-[1.25] text-text-100"><div class="group relative pt-6 pb-2" id="when-to-try-adaptive-thinking"><div class="absolute hidden lg:flex lg:items-center lg:-ml-8 top-[calc(1.5rem+0.05em)]"><button class="inline-flex

          ease-[cubic-bezier(0.165,0.85,0.45,1)] h-6 w-6 rounded-md active:scale-95 opacity-0 group-hover:opacity-100 transition-opacity duration-200 text-text-500 hover:text-text-100 Button_ghost__BUAoh" type="button" aria-label="Copy link to clipboard" title="Copy link to clipboard" data-state="closed"><div class="inline" style="width:20px;height:20px;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" style="flex-shrink:0" class="inline" aria-hidden="true"><path d="M13.6229 9.64789C13.8798 9.54672 14.1701 9.6724 14.2714 9.92914L15.2792 12.4878C16.0889 14.5432 15.0788 16.8666 13.0233 17.6763C11.0323 18.4603 8.79012 17.5367 7.91585 15.6098L7.83577 15.4204L6.82795 12.8618C6.72674 12.6048 6.85325 12.3145 7.11018 12.2133C7.36701 12.1122 7.65732 12.2379 7.75862 12.4946L8.76645 15.0532C9.37368 16.5947 11.1156 17.3528 12.6571 16.7456C14.1986 16.1384 14.9557 14.3965 14.3485 12.8549L13.3407 10.2963C13.2395 10.0395 13.3661 9.74917 13.6229 9.64789ZM8.90024 7.20842C9.15717 7.10721 9.44747 7.23372 9.54868 7.49065L11.3817 12.143C11.4826 12.3998 11.3563 12.6903 11.0995 12.7915C10.8426 12.8925 10.5523 12.766 10.451 12.5092L8.61898 7.85686C8.5178 7.59999 8.64342 7.30969 8.90024 7.20842ZM7.16975 2.25331C9.17539 1.57852 11.3796 2.58838 12.1639 4.5795L13.1718 7.13811C13.273 7.39504 13.1465 7.68534 12.8895 7.78655C12.6327 7.88749 12.3423 7.76113 12.2411 7.50432L11.2333 4.94571C10.6259 3.40439 8.88406 2.6471 7.3426 3.25429C5.80118 3.86161 5.04399 5.60345 5.65118 7.14494L6.659 9.70355C6.76021 9.96048 6.6337 10.2508 6.37677 10.352C6.11988 10.4531 5.82952 10.3266 5.72833 10.0698L4.7205 7.51116C3.91111 5.45581 4.92107 3.13323 6.97639 2.32362L7.16975 2.25331Z"></path></svg></div></button></div><div>When to try adaptive thinking</div><div class="absolute top-0 -right-6 hidden lg:flex"></div></div></h4>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">The extended thinking paths above use <code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">budget_tokens</code> for predictable token usage. If your workload fits one of the following patterns, consider trying <a class="inline-link" href="/docs/en/build-with-claude/adaptive-thinking">adaptive thinking</a> instead:</p>
<ul class="list-none pl-8 [&amp;_ul]:pl-8 [&amp;_ol]:pl-8 mb-4">
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]"><strong class="font-semibold">Autonomous multi-step agents:</strong> coding agents that turn requirements into working software, data analysis pipelines, and bug finding where the model runs independently across many steps. Adaptive thinking lets the model calibrate its reasoning per step, staying on path over longer trajectories. For these workloads, start at <code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">high</code> effort. If latency or token usage is a concern, scale down to <code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">medium</code>.</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]"><strong class="font-semibold">Computer use agents:</strong> Claude Sonnet 4.6 achieved best-in-class accuracy on computer use evaluations using adaptive mode.</li>
<li class="mb-2 last:mb-0 relative before:absolute before:left-[-2rem] before:w-6 before:text-center [ul&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[&#x27;&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:before:content-[counter(item)&#x27;.&#x27;] [ol&gt;&amp;]:[counter-increment:item]"><strong class="font-semibold">Bimodal workloads:</strong> a mix of easy and hard tasks where adaptive skips thinking on simple queries and reasons deeply on complex ones.</li>
</ul>
<p class="mb-2 last:mb-0">When using adaptive thinking, evaluate <code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">medium</code> and <code class="relative inline bg-bg-300 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-sm font-mono break-words box-decoration-clone">high</code> effort on your tasks. The right level depends on your workload&#x27;s tradeoff between quality, latency, and token usage.</p>

You are encouraged to take local, reversible actions like editing files or running tests, but for actions that are hard to reverse, affect shared systems, or could be destructive, ask the user before proceeding.\\n\\nExamples of actions that warrant confirmation:\\n- Destructive operations: deleting files or branches, dropping database tables, rm -rf\\n- Hard to reverse operations: git push --force, git reset --hard, amending published commits\\n- Operations visible to others: pushing code, commenting on PRs/issues, sending messages, modifying shared infrastructure\\n\\nWhen encountering obstacles, do not use destructive actions as a shortcut. In frontend design, this creates what users call the \"AI slop\" aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.\n\nFocus on:\n- Typography: Choose fonts that are beautiful, unique, and interesting. Avoid generic fonts like Arial and Inter; opt instead for distinctive choices that elevate the frontend's aesthetics.\n- Color \u0026 Theme: Commit to a cohesive aesthetic. Use CSS variables for consistency. Dominant colors with sharp accents outperform timid, evenly-distributed palettes. Draw from IDE themes and cultural aesthetics for inspiration.\n- Motion: Use animations for effects and micro-interactions. Prioritize CSS-only solutions for HTML. Use Motion library for React when available. Focus on high-impact moments: one well-orchestrated page load with staggered reveals (animation-delay) creates more delight than scattered micro-interactions.\n- Backgrounds: Create atmosphere and depth rather than defaulting to solid colors. Layer CSS gradients, use geometric patterns, or add contextual effects that match the overall aesthetic.\n\nAvoid generic AI-generated aesthetics:\n- Overused font families (Inter, Roboto, Arial, system fonts)\n- Clichd color schemes (particularly purple gradients on white backgrounds)\n- Predictable layouts and component patterns\n- Cookie-cutter design that lacks context-specific character\n\nInterpret creatively and make unexpected choices that feel genuinely designed for the context. Vary between light and dark themes, different fonts, different aesthetics. You still tend to converge on common choices (Space Grotesk, for example) across generations. Avoid this: it is critical that you think outside the box!\n\u003c/frontend_aesthetics\u003e"])</script><script
